attributes.action: work with the Department of Transport to upgrade the A303 trunk route.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Between Amesbury’s Countess roundabout in Wiltshire and the Podimore roundabout in Somerset the A303 has 4 short sections of single carriageway. These sections cause severe congestion as the dual-carriageways converge into 1 lane. Furthermore, on 3 of the sections there are speed cameras at which drivers slow disproportionately, further exacerbating the congestion.
In December 2007 the scheme to tunnel past Stonehenge was cancelled on cost grounds. Whilst there have been competing aspirations regarding this section it is now time for the Government to govern and direct the Department of Transport to upgrade the carriageway.
The bottlenecks should be removed by constructing a flyover at the Countess roundabout; widening to dual carriageway at Stonehenge; removing the Wilton roundabout and bypassing the villages of Winterboune Stoke and Chicklade. This will improve traffic flow for industry and tourism whilst reducing atmospheric pollution and noise pollution in the villages.
